original: Egerström, Christer Åke Folkesson, kommendörkapten. Rosenholm, f. 3/ 12/85 i Mjölby av öv:löjtn. Folke E. o. Ingrid Ekeman. G. 19 m. Signe Wachtmeister. Barn: Folke f. 21, Christina 22, Ingrid 23, Hans 27. — Sjöoff :ex. 06, KSHS 11, flygförarcer-tif. 16, L’école superieure æronautique i Paris 23. Res. t. Petersburg, Moskva o. Sevastopol i Ryssl. 12, Västindien o. Medelhavet 13-14, Turkiet o. Kaukasus 19-21. Anst. h. Faxe o. Co. i Malmö f. dess motorexp. t. Turkiet, Ryssl. o. Grekl. 19-21, besiktn :man å örlogsvarvet i Karlskrona sed. 32, äger o. bruk. Vesteråkra gård i Rosenholm sed. 32. RSO, KTunNI.
translated: Egerström, Christer Åke Folkesson, Commander Captain. Born on December 3, 1885 in Mjölby to Lieutenant Folke E. and Ingrid Ekeman. Married to Signe Wachtmeister in 1919. They have four children: Folke born in 1921, Christina born in 1922, Ingrid born in 1923, and Hans born in 1927. He trained in the navy in 1906 and graduated from KSHS in 1911. In 1916, he became an aviation sergeant and attended L'école superieure æronautique in Paris in 1923. He has lived in St. Petersburg, Moscow, and Sevastopol in Russia in 1912, in the West Indies and Mediterranean in 1913-14, and in Turkey and the Caucasus in 1919-21. He worked for Faxe and Co. in Malmö for their engine exports to Turkey, Russia, and Greece in 1919-21. He was a surveyor at the naval shipyard in Karlskrona since 1932 and owned and managed Vesteråkra farm in Rosenholm since 1932. He was awarded RSO and KTunNI.
